choices.name: Learn the basics of online Czech research.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Learn about Czech Republic resources in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Czech Republic Genealogy

  2. Basics: Learn about the basics of Czech research.

    ☆ LT—Basics of Czech Research

  3. Resources: Here are five places to search for Czech ancestors.

    ☆ TH—5 Places to Search for Your Czech Ancestors - 2019

  4. Learn about a variety of resources for Czech research.

    ☆ Genealogical Resources

  5. Town of Origin: Learn how to find the town of origin for a Czech ancestor.

    ☆ FS—Czech Republic Research With the Wiki Part 2 of 5: Czech Republic Finding Town of Origin—6:03


Records and Help
  1. Record Finder: Use the Czech Republic Republic Record Finder to understand record types for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Czech Republic Record Finder

  2. Watch this video to learn how to access Czech records.

    ☆ FS—Accessing Czech Records—93:36

  3. Forebears.io: Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.
  4. Correspondence: Use this guide for corresponding with Czech organizations about genealogy resources.

    ☆ FS—Czech Letter-Writing Guide

choices.name: Get familiar with the Czech language, genealogy terms, and naming patterns.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for language resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Languages: Get an introduction to Czech Republic languages in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Czech Republic Languages

  2. Terms: Review Czech genealogy terms in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Czech Republic Genealogy Terms

  3. Word Lists: For additional language resources, see the genealogical word lists for German and Latin.
Names
  1. FamilySearch: Learn about Czech names and naming patterns in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Czech Personal Names

  2. Learn more about Czech names and surnames.

    ☆ Czech Genealogy for Beginners

  3. Surnames: Search the ☆Geneanet site for Czech surnames.
  4. Search for ☆Czech surnames in a number of databases.
  5. Explore ☆surname distribution (a map where certain surnames are prevalent) in the Czech Republic.
  6. Explore pages on the ☆Czech American TV site for name and terminology resources.

Handwriting
  1. Reading Records: Learn how to read Czech Republic genealogy records.

    ☆ FS—Czech Republic Research With the Wiki Part 4 of 5: Reading Czech Republic Reords—6:15
    ☆ FS—Czech Republic Reading Aids

  2. Cursive: Here are some examples of Czech cursive handwriting for study.

    ☆ Czech Cursive Handwriting Examples from 1600-1935

choices.name: Learn about Czech emigration and immigration.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Get an introduction to Czech emigration and immigration resources in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Czech Republic Emigration and Immigration

  2. Wikipedia: Learn about immigration history and demographics in this Wikipedia article.

    ☆ Wikipedia: Czech Americans

  3. Tips: Get tips on tracking Czech immigrants to the United States.

    ☆ Czech Genealogy for Beginners: Immigration

  4. Case Study: Here is a case study in Czech family migration.

    ☆ Search for records in the bride's home village

  5. Silesian Indexes: Learn about using Silesian ancestor indexes for emigration.

    ☆ Silesian Emigrant Ancestor Indexes 1879-1881, 1889

choices.name: Learn about Czech Republic archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn how to use Czech archives after you've found an ancestral town.

    ☆ RT—Finding the Correct Czech Archive to Search for Your Ancestor—18:08 - 2022



  2. Get tips on searching archives, from the Czech Genealogy for Beginners and Czech Family Tree websites.
  3. FamilySearch: Explore Czech Republic archives on the FamilySearch Wiki.

    ☆ FS—Czech Republic Research With the Wiki Part 3 of 5: A Czech Republic Archival Region Page—5:14

  4. Chodovec Archive: Learn about the Chodovec Archive Complex in the Czech Republic.

    ☆ LT—The Chodovec Archive Complex, Czech Republic

  5. Actapublica: Learn about the Actapublica archival website.

    ☆ Introduction to Actapublica, Czech Genealogy—11:13 - 2013



  6. Jewish: Learn how to find Jewish records in the Czech National Archives.

    ☆ Finding Jewish Records at the Czech National Archives—20:24 - 2022

resources.description: Explore the Czech National Archives and the Czech Archive Society websites.
Explore the Czechoslovak Genealogical Society International (CGSI) website for articles and archive resources.

content.text:

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Czech Republic Church Records

  2. Resources: Learn about other resources for church records in this series of blog posts.

    ☆ Czech Genealogy for Beginners - 2019

  3. Use the Wiki Church Records web links for more information.
  4. Jewish: Explore Jewish genealogy in the Czech Republic and Slovakia in this guide from the ☆Center for Jewish History site.

    ☆ FS—Czech Republic Research With the Wiki Part 4 of 5: Reading Czech Republic Records—7:49

  6. Explore the ☆JewishGen Austria-Czech database.
  7. Explore the ☆Jewish Genealogy Encyclopedia for Jewish resources in the Czech Republic.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for the Czech Republic.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. Explore the Czech Family Tree website for access to Czech archive records.
  4. Explore the Europe page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

content.text:

  2. Visit the ☆Czech Slovak Genealogy Interest Group page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆Central Europe Genealogical Research Community page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Czech Republic.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Czech Republic research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆Czech Republic research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  2. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Czech Republic research.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community to read or post questions about Czech ancestors.
